text: Trump Maintains Advantage  —  Haley picks up independent support but does not close gap  —  West Long Branch, NJ - A smaller field and an increase in the number of independents who plan to vote in New Hampshire's Republican primary have boosted Nikki Haley's standing there.

Wall Street opposition to Trump collapses, as ‘pipe dream’ of primary defeat ends  — Many Wall Street executives have made a calculated decision not to speak out against Donald Trump, and in some cases they will consider supporting the Republican former president.

Supreme Court allows Border Patrol agents to remove razor wire installed by Texas at Mexico border  —  The court weighed in on a dispute between the Biden administration and Republican Gov. Greg Abbott, who installed the wire in an effort to prevent illegal border crossings.

Supreme Court clears way for border agents to remove Texas wire barrier  —  The Supreme Court sided with the Biden administration on Monday and cleared the way for border patrol agents to remove razor wire Texas officials installed along a busy stretch of the southern border until the legality of the barriers is resolved in court.

Fake Joe Biden robocall tells New Hampshire Democrats not to vote on Tuesday  —  The call, an apparent imitation or digital manipulation of the president's voice, says, “Voting this Tuesday only enables the Republicans in their quest to elect Donald Trump again.”

Norman Jewison, acclaimed director of ‘In the Heat of the Night’ and ‘Moonstruck,’ dead at 97  —  Norman Jewison, the acclaimed and versatile Canadian-born director whose Hollywood films ranged from Doris Day comedies and “Moonstruck” to social dramas such as the Oscar-winning “In the Heat of the Night,” has died at age 97.

Dexter Scott King, son of Martin Luther King Jr., dies at 62  —  The younger son of the late civil rights leader died in California after a bout with prostate cancer.  —  Dexter Scott King, the lookalike of his iconic father, the civil rights leader Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., has died.  He was 62.
